summary.long: Numbers is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: A year after Israel’s departure from Egypt, the Lord spoke to Moses in the Tabernacle in the wilderness of Sinai. On the first day of the second month of that year he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “From the whole community of Israel, record the names of all the warriors by their clans and families. List all the men
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: twenty years old or older who are able to go to war. You and Aaron must register the troops,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will be assisted by one family leader from each tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the tribes and the names of the leaders who will assist you:TribeLeaderReuben Elizur son of Shedeur
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah Nahshon son of Amminadab
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Issachar Nethanel son of Zuar
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebulun Eliab son of Helon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim son of Joseph Elishama son of AmmihudManasseh son of Joseph Gamaliel son of Pedahzur
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benjamin Abidan son of Gideoni
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asher Pagiel son of Ocran
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gad Eliasaph son of Deuel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naphtali Ahira son of Enan
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the chosen leaders of the community, the leaders of their ancestral tribes, the heads of the clans of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Aaron called together these chosen leaders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they assembled the whole community of Israel on that very day. All the people were registered according to their ancestry by their clans and families. The men of Israel who were twenty years old or older were listed one by one,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Lord had commanded Moses. So Moses recorded their names in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -This is the number of men twenty years old or older who were able to go to war, as their names were listed in the records of their clans and families:TribeNumberReuben (Jacob’s oldest son) 46,500
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Simeon 59,300
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Judah 74,600
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Issachar 54,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Zebulun 57,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Ephraim son of Joseph 40,500
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Manasseh son of Joseph 32,200
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Benjamin 35,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Asher 41,500
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Naphtali 53,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the men registered by Moses and Aaron and the twelve leaders of Israel, all listed according to their ancestral descent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were registered by families—all the men of Israel who were twenty years old or older and able to go to war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total number was 603,550.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this total did not include the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord had said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not include the tribe of Levi in the registration; do not count them with the rest of the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Put the Levites in charge of the Tabernacle of the Covenant, along with all its furnishings and equipment. They must carry the Tabernacle and all its furnishings as you travel, and they must take care of it and camp around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever it is time for the Tabernacle to move, the Levites will take it down. And when it is time to stop, they will set it up again. But any unauthorized person who goes too near the Tabernacle must be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each tribe of Israel will camp in a designated area with its own family banner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites will camp around the Tabernacle of the Covenant to protect the community of Israel from the Lord’s anger. The Levites are responsible to stand guard around the Tabernacle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelites did everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord gave these instructions to Moses and Aaron:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When the Israelites set up camp, each tribe will be assigned its own area. The tribal divisions will camp beneath their family banners on all four sides of the Tabernacle, but at some distance from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -“The divisions of Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun are to camp toward the sunrise on the east side of the Tabernacle, beneath their family banners. These are the names of the tribes, their leaders, and the numbers of their registered troops:TribeLeaderNumberJudah Nahshon son of Amminadab74,600
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -IssacharNethanel son of Zuar 54,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Zebulun Eliab son of Helon57,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the total of all the troops on Judah’s side of the camp is 186,400. These three tribes are to lead the way whenever the Israelites travel to a new campsite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -“The divisions of Reuben, Simeon, and Gad are to camp on the south side of the Tabernacle, beneath their family banners. These are the names of the tribes, their leaders, and the numbers of their registered troops:TribeLeaderNumberReubenElizur son of Shedeur 46,500
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Simeon Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai59,300
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -GadEliasaph son of Deuel 45,650
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the total of all the troops on Reuben’s side of the camp is 151,450. These three tribes will be second in line whenever the Israelites travel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the Tabernacle, carried by the Levites, will set out from the middle of the camp. All the tribes are to travel in the same order that they camp, each in position under the appropriate family banner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -“The divisions of Ephraim, Manasseh, and Benjamin are to camp on the west side of the Tabernacle, beneath their family banners. These are the names of the tribes, their leaders, and the numbers of their registered troops:TribeLeaderNumberEphraim Elishama son of Ammihud40,500
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -ManassehGamaliel son of Pedahzur 32,200
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Benjamin Abidan son of Gideoni35,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the total of all the troops on Ephraim’s side of the camp is 108,100. These three tribes will be third in line whenever the Israelites travel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -“The divisions of Dan, Asher, and Naphtali are to camp on the north side of the Tabernacle, beneath their family banners. These are the names of the tribes, their leaders, and the numbers of their registered troops:TribeLeaderNumberDanAhiezer son of Ammishaddai 62,700
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -Asher Pagiel son of Ocran41,500
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: -NaphtaliAhira son of Enan 53,400
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the total of all the troops on Dan’s side of the camp is 157,600. These three tribes will be last, marching under their banners whenever the Israelites travel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In summary, the troops of Israel listed by their families totaled 603,550.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as the Lord had commanded, the Levites were not included in this registration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people of Israel did everything as the Lord had commanded Moses. Each clan and family set up camp and marched under their banners exactly as the Lord had instructed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the family line of Aaron and Moses as it was recorded when the Lord spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The names of Aaron’s sons were Nadab (the oldest), Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These sons of Aaron were anointed and ordained to minister as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died in the Lord’s presence in the wilderness of Sinai when they burned before the Lord the wrong kind of fire, different than he had commanded. Since they had no sons, this left only Eleazar and Ithamar to serve as priests with their father, Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Call forward the tribe of Levi, and present them to Aaron the priest to serve as his assistants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will serve Aaron and the whole community, performing their sacred duties in and around the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will also maintain all the furnishings of the sacred tent, serving in the Tabernacle on behalf of all the Israelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons. They have been given from among all the people of Israel to serve as their assistants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Appoint Aaron and his sons to carry out the duties of the priesthood. But any unauthorized person who goes too near the sanctuary must be put to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look, I have chosen the Levites from among the Israelites to serve as substitutes for all the firstborn sons of the people of Israel. The Levites belong to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for all the firstborn males are mine. On the day I struck down all the firstborn sons of the Egyptians, I set apart for myself all the firstborn in Israel, both of people and of animals. They are mine; I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke again to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai. He said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Record the names of the members of the tribe of Levi by their families and clans. List every male who is one month old or older.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses listed them, just as the Lord had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Levi had three sons, whose names were Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clans descended from Gershon were named after two of his descendants, Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The clans descended from Kohath were named after four of his descendants, Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The clans descended from Merari were named after two of his descendants, Mahli and Mushi.
These were the Levite clans, listed according to their family groups.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gershon were composed of the clans descended from Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 7,500 males one month old or older among these Gershonite clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were assigned the area to the west of the Tabernacle for their camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of the Gershonite clans was Eliasaph son of Lael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two clans were responsible to care for the Tabernacle, including the sacred tent with its layers of coverings, the curtain at its entrance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the curtains of the courtyard that surrounded the Tabernacle and altar, the curtain at the courtyard entrance, the ropes, and all the equipment related to their use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Kohath were composed of the clans descended from Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 8,600 males one month old or older among these Kohathite clans. They were responsible for the care of the sanctuary,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were assigned the area south of the Tabernacle for their camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leader of the Kohathite clans was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These four clans were responsible for the care of the Ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the various articles used in the sanctuary, the inner curtain, and all the equipment related to their use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar, son of Aaron the priest, was the chief administrator over all the Levites, with special responsibility for the oversight of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Merari were composed of the clans descended from Mahli and Mushi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were 6,200 males one month old or older among these Merarite clans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were assigned the area north of the Tabernacle for their camp. The leader of the Merarite clans was Zuriel son of Abihail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These two clans were responsible for the care of the frames supporting the Tabernacle, the crossbars, the pillars, the bases, and all the equipment related to their use.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were also responsible for the posts of the courtyard and all their bases, pegs, and ropes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The area in front of the Tabernacle, in the east toward the sunrise, was reserved for the tents of Moses and of Aaron and his sons, who had the final responsibility for the sanctuary on behalf of the people of Israel. Anyone other than a priest or Levite who went too near the sanctuary was to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Moses and Aaron counted the Levite clans at the Lord’s command, the total number was 22,000 males one month old or older.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Now count all the firstborn sons in Israel who are one month old or older, and make a list of their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites must be reserved for me as substitutes for the firstborn sons of Israel; I am the Lord. And the Levites’ livestock must be reserved for me as substitutes for the firstborn livestock of the whole nation of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses counted the firstborn sons of the people of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of firstborn sons who were one month old or older was 22,273.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the Levites as substitutes for the firstborn sons of the people of Israel. And take the livestock of the Levites as substitutes for the firstborn livestock of the people of Israel. The Levites belong to me; I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are 273 more firstborn sons of Israel than there are Levites. To redeem these extra firstborn sons,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: collect five pieces of silver for each of them (each piece weighing the same as the sanctuary shekel, which equals twenty gerahs).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give the silver to Aaron and his sons as the redemption price for the extra firstborn sons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses collected the silver for redeeming the firstborn sons of Israel who exceeded the number of Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He collected 1,365 pieces of silver on behalf of these firstborn sons of Israel (each piece weighing the same as the sanctuary shekel).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave the silver for the redemption to Aaron and his sons, just as the Lord had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Record the names of the members of the clans and families of the Kohathite division of the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: List all the men between the ages of thirty and fifty who are eligible to serve in the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The duties of the Kohathites at the Tabernacle will relate to the most sacred objects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the camp moves, Aaron and his sons must enter the Tabernacle first to take down the inner curtain and cover the Ark of the Covenant with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they must cover the inner curtain with fine goatskin leather and spread over that a single piece of blue cloth. Finally, they must put the carrying poles of the Ark in place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next they must spread a blue cloth over the table where the Bread of the Presence is displayed, and on the cloth they will place the bowls, ladles, jars, pitchers, and the special bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must spread a scarlet cloth over all of this, and finally a covering of fine goatskin leather on top of the scarlet cloth. Then they must insert the carrying poles into the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next they must cover the lampstand with a blue cloth, along with its lamps, lamp snuffers, trays, and special jars of olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they must cover the lampstand and its accessories with fine goatskin leather and place the bundle on a carrying frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next they must spread a blue cloth over the gold incense altar and cover this cloth with fine goatskin leather. Then they must attach the carrying poles to the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must take all the remaining furnishings of the sanctuary and wrap them in a blue cloth, cover them with fine goatskin leather, and place them on the carrying frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They must remove the ashes from the altar for sacrifices and cover the altar with a purple cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the altar utensils—the firepans, meat forks, shovels, basins, and all the containers—must be placed on the cloth, and a covering of fine goatskin leather must be spread over them. Finally, they must put the carrying poles in place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The camp will be ready to move when Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the sacred articles. The Kohathites will come and carry these things to the next destination. But they must not touch the sacred objects, or they will die. So these are the things from the Tabernacle that the Kohathites must carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Eleazar son of Aaron the priest will be responsible for the oil of the lampstand, the fragrant incense, the daily grain offering, and the anointing oil. In fact, Eleazar will be responsible for the entire Tabernacle and everything in it, including the sanctuary and its furnishings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses and Aaron,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not let the Kohathite clans be destroyed from among the Levites!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what you must do so they will live and not die when they approach the most sacred objects. Aaron and his sons must always go in with them and assign a specific duty or load to each person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Kohathites must never enter the sanctuary to look at the sacred objects for even a moment, or they will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Record the names of the members of the clans and families of the Gershonite division of the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: List all the men between the ages of thirty and fifty who are eligible to serve in the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These Gershonite clans will be responsible for general service and carrying loads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must carry the curtains of the Tabernacle, the Tabernacle itself with its coverings, the outer covering of fine goatskin leather, and the curtain for the Tabernacle entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are also to carry the curtains for the courtyard walls that surround the Tabernacle and altar, the curtain across the courtyard entrance, the ropes, and all the equipment related to their use. The Gershonites are responsible for all these items.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron and his sons will direct the Gershonites regarding all their duties, whether it involves moving the equipment or doing other work. They must assign the Gershonites responsibility for the loads they are to carry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these are the duties assigned to the Gershonite clans at the Tabernacle. They will be directly responsible to Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now record the names of the members of the clans and families of the Merarite division of the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: List all the men between the ages of thirty and fifty who are eligible to serve in the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Their only duty at the Tabernacle will be to carry loads. They will carry the frames of the Tabernacle, the crossbars, the posts, and the bases;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also the posts for the courtyard walls with their bases, pegs, and ropes; and all the accessories and everything else related to their use. Assign the various loads to each man by name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these are the duties of the Merarite clans at the Tabernacle. They are directly responsible to Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses, Aaron, and the other leaders of the community listed the members of the Kohathite division by their clans and families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The list included all the men between thirty and fifty years of age who were eligible for service in the Tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the total number came to 2,750.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this was the total of all those from the Kohathite clans who were eligible to serve at the Tabernacle. Moses and Aaron listed them, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Gershonite division was also listed by its clans and families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The list included all the men between thirty and fifty years of age who were eligible for service in the Tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the total number came to 2,630.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this was the total of all those from the Gershonite clans who were eligible to serve at the Tabernacle. Moses and Aaron listed them, just as the Lord had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Merarite division was also listed by its clans and families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The list included all the men between thirty and fifty years of age who were eligible for service in the Tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the total number came to 3,200.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this was the total of all those from the Merarite clans who were eligible for service. Moses and Aaron listed them, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel listed all the Levites by their clans and families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the men between thirty and fifty years of age who were eligible for service in the Tabernacle and for its transportation
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: numbered 8,580.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When their names were recorded, as the Lord had commanded through Moses, each man was assigned his task and told what to carry.
And so the registration was completed, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord gave these instructions to Moses:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the people of Israel to remove from the camp anyone who has a skin disease or a discharge, or who has become ceremonially unclean by touching a dead person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This command applies to men and women alike. Remove them so they will not defile the camp in which I live among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelites did as the Lord had commanded Moses and removed such people from the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel: If any of the people—men or women—betray the Lord by doing wrong to another person, they are guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must confess their sin and make full restitution for what they have done, adding an additional 20 percent and returning it to the person who was wronged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the person who was wronged is dead, and there are no near relatives to whom restitution can be made, the payment belongs to the Lord and must be given to the priest. Those who are guilty must also bring a ram as a sacrifice, and they will be purified and made right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the sacred offerings that the Israelites bring to a priest will belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each priest may keep all the sacred donations that he receives.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give the following instructions to the people of Israel.
“Suppose a man’s wife goes astray, and she is unfaithful to her husband
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has sex with another man, but neither her husband nor anyone else knows about it. She has defiled herself, even though there was no witness and she was not caught in the act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her husband becomes jealous and is suspicious of his wife and needs to know whether or not she has defiled herself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the husband must bring his wife to the priest. He must also bring an offering of two quarts of barley flour to be presented on her behalf. Do not mix it with olive oil or frankincense, for it is a jealousy offering—an offering to prove whether or not she is guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The priest will then present her to stand trial before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must take some holy water in a clay jar and pour into it dust he has taken from the Tabernacle floor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priest has presented the woman before the Lord, he must unbind her hair and place in her hands the offering of proof—the jealousy offering to determine whether her husband’s suspicions are justified. The priest will stand before her, holding the jar of bitter water that brings a curse to those who are guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will then put the woman under oath and say to her, ‘If no other man has had sex with you, and you have not gone astray and defiled yourself while under your husband’s authority, may you be immune from the effects of this bitter water that brings on the curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you have gone astray by being unfaithful to your husband, and have defiled yourself by having sex with another man—’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At this point the priest must put the woman under oath by saying, ‘May the people know that the Lord’s curse is upon you when he makes you infertile, causing your womb to shrivel and your abdomen to swell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may this water that brings the curse enter your body and cause your abdomen to swell and your womb to shrivel.’ And the woman will be required to say, ‘Yes, let it be so.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest will write these curses on a piece of leather and wash them off into the bitter water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will make the woman drink the bitter water that brings on the curse. When the water enters her body, it will cause bitter suffering if she is guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The priest will take the jealousy offering from the woman’s hand, lift it up before the Lord, and carry it to the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will take a handful of the flour as a token portion and burn it on the altar, and he will require the woman to drink the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she has defiled herself by being unfaithful to her husband, the water that brings on the curse will cause bitter suffering. Her abdomen will swell and her womb will shrink, and her name will become a curse among her people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if she has not defiled herself and is pure, then she will be unharmed and will still be able to have children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the ritual law for dealing with suspicion. If a woman goes astray and defiles herself while under her husband’s authority,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or if a man becomes jealous and is suspicious that his wife has been unfaithful, the husband must present his wife before the Lord, and the priest will apply this entire ritual law to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The husband will be innocent of any guilt in this matter, but his wife will be held accountable for her sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give the following instructions to the people of Israel.
“If any of the people, either men or women, take the special vow of a Nazirite, setting themselves apart to the Lord in a special way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they must give up wine and other alcoholic drinks. They must not use vinegar made from wine or from other alcoholic drinks, they must not drink fresh grape juice, and they must not eat grapes or raisins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as they are bound by their Nazirite vow, they are not allowed to eat or drink anything that comes from a grapevine—not even the grape seeds or skins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They must never cut their hair throughout the time of their vow, for they are holy and set apart to the Lord. Until the time of their vow has been fulfilled, they must let their hair grow long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they must not go near a dead body during the entire period of their vow to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if the dead person is their own father, mother, brother, or sister, they must not defile themselves, for the hair on their head is the symbol of their separation to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This requirement applies as long as they are set apart to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If someone falls dead beside them, the hair they have dedicated will be defiled. They must wait for seven days and then shave their heads. Then they will be cleansed from their defilement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day they must bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will offer one of the birds for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering. In this way, he will purify them from the guilt they incurred through contact with the dead body. Then they must reaffirm their commitment and let their hair begin to grow again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The days of their vow that were completed before their defilement no longer count. They must rededicate themselves to the Lord as a Nazirite for the full term of their vow, and each must bring a one-year-old male lamb for a guilt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the ritual law for Nazirites. At the conclusion of their time of separation as Nazirites, they must each go to the entrance of the Tabernacle
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and offer their sacrifices to the Lord: a one-year-old male lamb without defect for a burnt offering, a one-year-old female lamb without defect for a sin offering, a ram without defect for a peace offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a basket of bread made without yeast—cakes of choice flour mixed with olive oil and wafers spread with olive oil—along with their prescribed grain offerings and liquid offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priest will present these offerings before the Lord: first the sin offering and the burnt offering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the ram for a peace offering, along with the basket of bread made without yeast. The priest must also present the prescribed grain offering and liquid offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then the Nazirites will shave their heads at the entrance of the Tabernacle. They will take the hair that had been dedicated and place it on the fire beneath the peace-offering sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the Nazirite’s head has been shaved, the priest will take for each of them the boiled shoulder of the ram, and he will take from the basket a cake and a wafer made without yeast. He will put them all into the Nazirite’s hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest will lift them up as a special offering before the Lord. These are holy portions for the priest, along with the breast of the special offering and the thigh of the sacred offering that are lifted up before the Lord. After this ceremony the Nazirites may again drink wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the ritual law of the Nazirites, who vow to bring these offerings to the Lord. They may also bring additional offerings if they can afford it. And they must be careful to do whatever they vowed when they set themselves apart as Nazirites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell Aaron and his sons to bless the people of Israel with this special blessing:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘May the Lord bless you
    and protect you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord smile on you
    and be gracious to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the Lord show you his favor
    and give you his peace.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Aaron and his sons bless the people of Israel in my name, I myself will bless them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day Moses set up the Tabernacle, he anointed it and set it apart as holy. He also anointed and set apart all its furnishings and the altar with its utensils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders of Israel—the tribal leaders who had registered the troops—came and brought their offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Together they brought six large wagons and twelve oxen. There was a wagon for every two leaders and an ox for each leader. They presented these to the Lord in front of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Receive their gifts, and use these oxen and wagons for transporting the Tabernacle. Distribute them among the Levites according to the work they have to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the wagons and oxen and presented them to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gave two wagons and four oxen to the Gershonite division for their work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he gave four wagons and eight oxen to the Merarite division for their work. All their work was done under the leadership of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he gave none of the wagons or oxen to the Kohathite division, since they were required to carry the sacred objects of the Tabernacle on their shoulders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leaders also presented dedication gifts for the altar at the time it was anointed. They each placed their gifts before the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Let one leader bring his gift each day for the dedication of the altar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day Nahshon son of Amminadab, leader of the tribe of Judah, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Nahshon son of Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the second day Nethanel son of Zuar, leader of the tribe of Issachar, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Nethanel son of Zuar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the third day Eliab son of Helon, leader of the tribe of Zebulun, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Eliab son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fourth day Elizur son of Shedeur, leader of the tribe of Reuben, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Elizur son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the fifth day Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai, leader of the tribe of Simeon, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the sixth day Eliasaph son of Deuel, leader of the tribe of Gad, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Eliasaph son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day Elishama son of Ammihud, leader of the tribe of Ephraim, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Elishama son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day Gamaliel son of Pedahzur, leader of the tribe of Manasseh, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the ninth day Abidan son of Gideoni, leader of the tribe of Benjamin, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Abidan son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the tenth day Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai, leader of the tribe of Dan, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eleventh day Pagiel son of Ocran, leader of the tribe of Asher, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Pagiel son of Ocran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the twelfth day Ahira son of Enan, leader of the tribe of Naphtali, presented his offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His offering consisted of a silver platter weighing 3 1⁄4 pounds and a silver basin weighing 1 3⁄4 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). These were both filled with grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also brought a gold container weighing four ounces, which was filled with incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought a young bull, a ram, and a one-year-old male lamb for a burnt offering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a male goat for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a peace offering he brought two bulls, five rams, five male goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering brought by Ahira son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So this was the dedication offering brought by the leaders of Israel at the time the altar was anointed: twelve silver platters, twelve silver basins, and twelve gold incense containers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each silver platter weighed 3 1⁄4 pounds, and each silver basin weighed 1 3⁄4 pounds. The total weight of the silver was 60 pounds (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of the twelve gold containers that was filled with incense weighed four ounces (as measured by the weight of the sanctuary shekel). The total weight of the gold was three pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twelve young bulls, twelve rams, and twelve one-year-old male lambs were donated for the burnt offerings, along with their prescribed grain offerings. Twelve male goats were brought for the sin offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twenty-four bulls, sixty rams, sixty male goats, and sixty one-year-old male lambs were donated for the peace offerings. This was the dedication offering for the altar after it was anointed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever Moses went into the Tabernacle to speak with the Lord, he heard the voice speaking to him from between the two cherubim above the Ark’s cover—the place of atonement—that rests on the Ark of the Covenant. The Lord spoke to him from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give Aaron the following instructions: When you set up the seven lamps in the lampstand, place them so their light shines forward in front of the lampstand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Aaron did this. He set up the seven lamps so they reflected their light forward, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The entire lampstand, from its base to its decorative blossoms, was made of beaten gold. It was built according to the exact design the Lord had shown Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now set the Levites apart from the rest of the people of Israel and make them ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this by sprinkling them with the water of purification, and have them shave their entire body and wash their clothing. Then they will be ceremonially clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have them bring a young bull and a grain offering of choice flour moistened with olive oil, along with a second young bull for a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then assemble the whole community of Israel, and present the Levites at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you present the Levites before the Lord, the people of Israel must lay their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Raising his hands, Aaron must then present the Levites to the Lord as a special offering from the people of Israel, thus dedicating them to the Lord’s service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Next the Levites will lay their hands on the heads of the young bulls. Present one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to the Lord, to purify the Levites and make them right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then have the Levites stand in front of Aaron and his sons, and raise your hands and present them as a special offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way, you will set the Levites apart from the rest of the people of Israel, and the Levites will belong to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, they may go into the Tabernacle to do their work, because you have purified them and presented them as a special offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Of all the people of Israel, the Levites are reserved for me. I have claimed them for myself in place of all the firstborn sons of the Israelites; I have taken the Levites as their substitutes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the firstborn males among the people of Israel are mine, both of people and of animals. I set them apart for myself on the day I struck down all the firstborn sons of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I have claimed the Levites in place of all the firstborn sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of all the Israelites, I have assigned the Levites to Aaron and his sons. They will serve in the Tabernacle on behalf of the Israelites and make sacrifices to purify the people so no plague will strike them when they approach the sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses, Aaron, and the whole community of Israel dedicated the Levites, carefully following all the Lord’s instructions to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites purified themselves from sin and washed their clothes, and Aaron lifted them up and presented them to the Lord as a special offering. He then offered a sacrifice to purify them and make them right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that the Levites went into the Tabernacle to perform their duties, assisting Aaron and his sons. So they carried out all the commands that the Lord gave Moses concerning the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also instructed Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the rule the Levites must follow: They must begin serving in the Tabernacle at the age of twenty-five,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they must retire at the age of fifty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After retirement they may assist their fellow Levites by serving as guards at the Tabernacle, but they may not officiate in the service. This is how you must assign duties to the Levites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A year after Israel’s departure from Egypt, the Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai. In the first month of that year he said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the Israelites to celebrate the Passover at the prescribed time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: at twilight on the fourteenth day of the first month. Be sure to follow all my decrees and regulations concerning this celebration.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses told the people to celebrate the Passover
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the wilderness of Sinai as twilight fell on the fourteenth day of the month. And they celebrated the festival there, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of the men had been ceremonially defiled by touching a dead body, so they could not celebrate the Passover that day. They came to Moses and Aaron that day
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “We have become ceremonially unclean by touching a dead body. But why should we be prevented from presenting the Lord’s offering at the proper time with the rest of the Israelites?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses answered, “Wait here until I have received instructions for you from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the Lord’s reply to Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel: If any of the people now or in future generations are ceremonially unclean at Passover time because of touching a dead body, or if they are on a journey and cannot be present at the ceremony, they may still celebrate the Lord’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must offer the Passover sacrifice one month later, at twilight on the fourteenth day of the second month. They must eat the Passover lamb at that time with bitter salad greens and bread made without yeast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must not leave any of the lamb until the next morning, and they must not break any of its bones. They must follow all the normal regulations concerning the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But those who neglect to celebrate the Passover at the regular time, even though they are ceremonially clean and not away on a trip, will be cut off from the community of Israel. If they fail to present the Lord’s offering at the proper time, they will suffer the consequences of their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if foreigners living among you want to celebrate the Passover to the Lord, they must follow these same decrees and regulations. The same laws apply both to native-born Israelites and to the foreigners living among you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day the Tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered it. But from evening until morning the cloud over the Tabernacle looked like a pillar of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the regular pattern—at night the cloud that covered the Tabernacle had the appearance of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the cloud lifted from over the sacred tent, the people of Israel would break camp and follow it. And wherever the cloud settled, the people of Israel would set up camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this way, they traveled and camped at the Lord’s command wherever he told them to go. Then they remained in their camp as long as the cloud stayed over the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the cloud remained over the Tabernacle for a long time, the Israelites stayed and performed their duty to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sometimes the cloud would stay over the Tabernacle for only a few days, so the people would stay for only a few days, as the Lord commanded. Then at the Lord’s command they would break camp and move on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sometimes the cloud stayed only overnight and lifted the next morning. But day or night, when the cloud lifted, the people broke camp and moved on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether the cloud stayed above the Tabernacle for two days, a month, or a year, the people of Israel stayed in camp and did not move on. But as soon as it lifted, they broke camp and moved on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they camped or traveled at the Lord’s command, and they did whatever the Lord told them through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Make two trumpets of hammered silver for calling the community to assemble and for signaling the breaking of camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When both trumpets are blown, everyone must gather before you at the entrance of the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if only one trumpet is blown, then only the leaders—the heads of the clans of Israel—must present themselves to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you sound the signal to move on, the tribes camped on the east side of the Tabernacle must break camp and move forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you sound the signal a second time, the tribes camped on the south will follow. You must sound short blasts as the signal for moving on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when you call the people to an assembly, blow the trumpets with a different signal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the priests, Aaron’s descendants, are allowed to blow the trumpets. This is a permanent law for you, to be observed from generation to generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you arrive in your own land and go to war against your enemies who attack you, sound the alarm with the trumpets. Then the Lord your God will remember you and rescue you from your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blow the trumpets in times of gladness, too, sounding them at your annual festivals and at the beginning of each month. And blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and peace offerings. The trumpets will remind your God of his covenant with you. I am the Lord your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the second year after Israel’s departure from Egypt—on the twentieth day of the second month—the cloud lifted from the Tabernacle of the Covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Israelites set out from the wilderness of Sinai and traveled on from place to place until the cloud stopped in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people set out for the first time, following the instructions the Lord had given through Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah’s troops led the way. They marched behind their banner, and their leader was Nahshon son of Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were joined by the troops of the tribe of Issachar, led by Nethanel son of Zuar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the troops of the tribe of Zebulun, led by Eliab son of Helon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Tabernacle was taken down, and the Gershonite and Merarite divisions of the Levites were next in the line of march, carrying the Tabernacle with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben’s troops went next, marching behind their banner. Their leader was Elizur son of Shedeur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were joined by the troops of the tribe of Simeon, led by Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the troops of the tribe of Gad, led by Eliasaph son of Deuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next came the Kohathite division of the Levites, carrying the sacred objects from the Tabernacle. Before they arrived at the next camp, the Tabernacle would already be set up at its new location.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim’s troops went next, marching behind their banner. Their leader was Elishama son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were joined by the troops of the tribe of Manasseh, led by Gamaliel son of Pedahzur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the troops of the tribe of Benjamin, led by Abidan son of Gideoni.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan’s troops went last, marching behind their banner and serving as the rear guard for all the tribal camps. Their leader was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were joined by the troops of the tribe of Asher, led by Pagiel son of Ocran,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the troops of the tribe of Naphtali, led by Ahira son of Enan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the order in which the Israelites marched, division by division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One day Moses said to his brother-in-law, Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, “We are on our way to the place the Lord promised us, for he said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will treat you well, for the Lord has promised wonderful blessings for Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Hobab replied, “No, I will not go. I must return to my own land and family.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please don’t leave us,” Moses pleaded. “You know the places in the wilderness where we should camp. Come, be our guide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do, we’ll share with you all the blessings the Lord gives us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They marched for three days after leaving the mountain of the Lord, with the Ark of the Lord’s Covenant moving ahead of them to show them where to stop and rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they moved on each day, the cloud of the Lord hovered over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whenever the Ark set out, Moses would shout, “Arise, O Lord, and let your enemies be scattered! Let them flee before you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the Ark was set down, he would say, “Return, O Lord, to the countless thousands of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon the people began to complain about their hardship, and the Lord heard everything they said. Then the Lord’s anger blazed against them, and he sent a fire to rage among them, and he destroyed some of the people in the outskirts of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people screamed to Moses for help, and when he prayed to the Lord, the fire stopped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After that, the area was known as Taberah (which means “the place of burning”), because fire from the Lord had burned among them there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the foreign rabble who were traveling with the Israelites began to crave the good things of Egypt. And the people of Israel also began to complain. “Oh, for some meat!” they exclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We remember the fish we used to eat for free in Egypt. And we had all the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions, and garlic we wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now our appetites are gone. All we ever see is this manna!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The manna looked like small coriander seeds, and it was pale yellow like gum resin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people would go out and gather it from the ground. They made flour by grinding it with hand mills or pounding it in mortars. Then they boiled it in a pot and made it into flat cakes. These cakes tasted like pastries baked with olive oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The manna came down on the camp with the dew during the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses heard all the families standing in the doorways of their tents whining, and the Lord became extremely angry. Moses was also very aggravated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said to the Lord, “Why are you treating me, your servant, so harshly? Have mercy on me! What did I do to deserve the burden of all these people?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I give birth to them? Did I bring them into the world? Why did you tell me to carry them in my arms like a mother carries a nursing baby? How can I carry them to the land you swore to give their ancestors?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where am I supposed to get meat for all these people? They keep whining to me, saying, ‘Give us meat to eat!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can’t carry all these people by myself! The load is far too heavy!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this is how you intend to treat me, just go ahead and kill me. Do me a favor and spare me this misery!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Gather before me seventy men who are recognized as elders and leaders of Israel. Bring them to the Tabernacle to stand there with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will come down and talk to you there. I will take some of the Spirit that is upon you, and I will put the Spirit upon them also. They will bear the burden of the people along with you, so you will not have to carry it alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And say to the people, ‘Purify yourselves, for tomorrow you will have meat to eat. You were whining, and the Lord heard you when you cried, “Oh, for some meat! We were better off in Egypt!” Now the Lord will give you meat, and you will have to eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it won’t be for just a day or two, or for five or ten or even twenty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat it for a whole month until you gag and are sick of it. For you have rejected the Lord, who is here among you, and you have whined to him, saying, “Why did we ever leave Egypt?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses responded to the Lord, “There are 600,000 foot soldiers here with me, and yet you say, ‘I will give them meat for a whole month!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if we butchered all our flocks and herds, would that satisfy them? Even if we caught all the fish in the sea, would that be enough?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Has my arm lost its power? Now you will see whether or not my word comes true!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went out and reported the Lord’s words to the people. He gathered the seventy elders and stationed them around the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to Moses. Then he gave the seventy elders the same Spirit that was upon Moses. And when the Spirit rested upon them, they prophesied. But this never happened again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two men, Eldad and Medad, had stayed behind in the camp. They were listed among the elders, but they had not gone out to the Tabernacle. Yet the Spirit rested upon them as well, so they prophesied there in the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A young man ran and reported to Moses, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua son of Nun, who had been Moses’ assistant since his youth, protested, “Moses, my master, make them stop!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses replied, “Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all the Lord’s people were prophets and that the Lord would put his Spirit upon them all!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses returned to the camp with the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord sent a wind that brought quail from the sea and let them fall all around the camp. For miles in every direction there were quail flying about three feet above the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people went out and caught quail all that day and throughout the night and all the next day, too. No one gathered less than fifty bushels! They spread the quail all around the camp to dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while they were gorging themselves on the meat—while it was still in their mouths—the anger of the Lord blazed against the people, and he struck them with a severe plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that place was called Kibroth-hattaavah (which means “graves of gluttony”) because there they buried the people who had craved meat from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Kibroth-hattaavah the Israelites traveled to Hazeroth, where they stayed for some time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were at Hazeroth, Miriam and Aaron criticized Moses because he had married a Cushite woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Has the Lord spoken only through Moses? Hasn’t he spoken through us, too?” But the Lord heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Moses was very humble—more humble than any other person on earth.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So immediately the Lord called to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam and said, “Go out to the Tabernacle, all three of you!” So the three of them went to the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord descended in the pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the Tabernacle. “Aaron and Miriam!” he called, and they stepped forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Lord said to them, “Now listen to what I say:
“If there were prophets among you,
    I, the Lord, would reveal myself in visions.
    I would speak to them in dreams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But not with my servant Moses.
    Of all my house, he is the one I trust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I speak to him face to face,
    clearly, and not in riddles!
    He sees the Lord as he is.
So why were you not afraid
    to criticize my servant Moses?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord was very angry with them, and he departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the cloud moved from above the Tabernacle, there stood Miriam, her skin as white as snow from leprosy. When Aaron saw what had happened to her,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he cried out to Moses, “Oh, my master! Please don’t punish us for this sin we have so foolishly committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t let her be like a stillborn baby, already decayed at birth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses cried out to the Lord, “O God, I beg you, please heal her!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord said to Moses, “If her father had done nothing more than spit in her face, wouldn’t she be defiled for seven days? So keep her outside the camp for seven days, and after that she may be accepted back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Miriam was kept outside the camp for seven days, and the people waited until she was brought back before they traveled again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they left Hazeroth and camped in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord now said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send out men to explore the land of Canaan, the land I am giving to the Israelites. Send one leader from each of the twelve ancestral tribes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did as the Lord commanded him. He sent out twelve men, all tribal leaders of Israel, from their camp in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the tribes and the names of their leaders:TribeLeaderReuben Shammua son of Zaccur
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon Shaphat son of Hori
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah Caleb son of Jephunneh
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Issachar Igal son of Joseph
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim Hoshea son of Nun
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benjamin Palti son of Raphu
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebulun Gaddiel son of Sodi
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh son of Joseph Gaddi son of Susi
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan Ammiel son of Gemalli
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asher Sethur son of Michael
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naphtali Nahbi son of Vophsi
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gad Geuel son of Maki
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men Moses sent out to explore the land. (Moses called Hoshea son of Nun by the name Joshua.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave the men these instructions as he sent them out to explore the land: “Go north through the Negev into the hill country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See what the land is like, and find out whether the people living there are strong or weak, few or many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See what kind of land they live in. Is it good or bad? Do their towns have walls, or are they unprotected like open camps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the soil fertile or poor? Are there many trees? Do your best to bring back samples of the crops you see.” (It happened to be the season for harvesting the first ripe grapes.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up and explored the land from the wilderness of Zin as far as Rehob, near Lebo-hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Going north, they passed through the Negev and arrived at Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai—all descendants of Anak—lived. (The ancient town of Hebron was founded seven years before the Egyptian city of Zoan.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the valley of Eshcol, they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes so large that it took two of them to carry it on a pole between them! They also brought back samples of the pomegranates and figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That place was called the valley of Eshcol (which means “cluster”), because of the cluster of grapes the Israelite men cut there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After exploring the land for forty days, the men returned
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Moses, Aaron, and the whole community of Israel at Kadesh in the wilderness of Paran. They reported to the whole community what they had seen and showed them the fruit they had taken from the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was their report to Moses: “We entered the land you sent us to explore, and it is indeed a bountiful country—a land flowing with milk and honey. Here is the kind of fruit it produces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people living there are powerful, and their towns are large and fortified. We even saw giants there, the descendants of Anak!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Amalekites live in the Negev, and the Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites live in the hill country. The Canaanites live along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea and along the Jordan Valley.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Caleb tried to quiet the people as they stood before Moses. “Let’s go at once to take the land,” he said. “We can certainly conquer it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the other men who had explored the land with him disagreed. “We can’t go up against them! They are stronger than we are!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they spread this bad report about the land among the Israelites: “The land we traveled through and explored will devour anyone who goes to live there. All the people we saw were huge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We even saw giants there, the descendants of Anak. Next to them we felt like grasshoppers, and that’s what they thought, too!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole community began weeping aloud, and they cried all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their voices rose in a great chorus of protest against Moses and Aaron. “If only we had died in Egypt, or even here in the wilderness!” they complained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why is the Lord taking us to this country only to have us die in battle? Our wives and our little ones will be carried off as plunder! Wouldn’t it be better for us to return to Egypt?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they plotted among themselves, “Let’s choose a new leader and go back to Egypt!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell face down on the ground before the whole community of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Two of the men who had explored the land, Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, tore their clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to all the people of Israel, “The land we traveled through and explored is a wonderful land!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the Lord is pleased with us, he will bring us safely into that land and give it to us. It is a rich land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not rebel against the Lord, and don’t be afraid of the people of the land. They are only helpless prey to us! They have no protection, but the Lord is with us! Don’t be afraid of them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the whole community began to talk about stoning Joshua and Caleb. Then the glorious presence of the Lord appeared to all the Israelites at the Tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator
