verses.text: Present him to Eleazar the priest before the whole community, and publicly commission him to lead the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Transfer some of your authority to him so the whole community of Israel will obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When direction from the Lord is needed, Joshua will stand before Eleazar the priest, who will use the Urim—one of the sacred lots cast before the Lord—to determine his will. This is how Joshua and the rest of the community of Israel will determine everything they should do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses did as the Lord commanded. He presented Joshua to Eleazar the priest and the whole community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses laid his hands on him and commissioned him to lead the people, just as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give these instructions to the people of Israel: The offerings you present as special gifts are a pleasing aroma to me; they are my food. See to it that they are brought at the appointed times and offered according to my instructions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say to the people: This is the special gift you must present to the Lord as your daily burnt offering. You must offer two one-year-old male lambs with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sacrifice one lamb in the morning and the other in the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With each lamb you must offer a grain offering of two quarts of choice flour mixed with one quart of pure oil of pressed olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount Sinai as a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along with it you must present the proper liquid offering of one quart of alcoholic drink with each lamb, poured out in the Holy Place as an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Offer the second lamb in the evening with the same grain offering and liquid offering. It, too, is a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the Sabbath day, sacrifice two one-year-old male lambs with no defects. They must be accompanied by a grain offering of four quarts of choice flour moistened with olive oil, and a liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the burnt offering to be presented each Sabbath day, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its accompanying liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of each month, present an extra burnt offering to the Lord of two young bulls, one ram, and seven one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These must be accompanied by grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil—six quarts with each bull, four quarts with the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two quarts with each lamb. This burnt offering will be a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also present a liquid offering with each sacrifice: two quarts of wine for each bull, a third of a gallon for the ram, and one quart for each lamb. Present this monthly burnt offering on the first day of each month throughout the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the first day of each month, you must also offer one male goat for a sin offering to the Lord. This is in addition to the regular burnt offering and its accompanying liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fourteenth day of the first month, you must celebrate the Lord’s Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the following day—the fifteenth day of the month—a joyous, seven-day festival will begin, but no bread made with yeast may be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first day of the festival will be an official day for holy assembly, and no ordinary work may be done on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a special gift you must present a burnt offering to the Lord—two young bulls, one ram, and seven one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These will be accompanied by grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil—six quarts with each bull, four quarts with the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two quarts with each of the seven lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also offer a male goat as a sin offering to purify yourselves and make yourselves right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Present these offerings in addition to your regular morning burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On each of the seven days of the festival, this is how you must prepare the food offering that is presented as a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord. These will be offered in addition to the regular burnt offerings and liquid offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh day of the festival will be another official day for holy assembly, and no ordinary work may be done on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the Festival of Harvest, when you present the first of your new grain to the Lord, you must call an official day for holy assembly, and you may do no ordinary work on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Present a special burnt offering on that day as a pleasing aroma to the Lord. It will consist of two young bulls, one ram, and seven one-year-old male lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These will be accompanied by grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil—six quarts with each bull, four quarts with the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two quarts with each of the seven lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, offer one male goat to purify yourselves and make yourselves right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prepare these special burnt offerings, along with their liquid offerings, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its accompanying grain offering. Be sure that all the animals you sacrifice have no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Celebrate the Festival of Trumpets each year on the first day of the appointed month in early autumn. You must call an official day for holy assembly, and you may do no ordinary work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day you must present a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord. It will consist of one young bull, one ram, and seven one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These must be accompanied by grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil—six quarts with the bull, four quarts with the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two quarts with each of the seven lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition, you must sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering to purify yourselves and make yourselves right with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These special sacrifices are in addition to your regular monthly and daily burnt offerings, and they must be given with their prescribed grain offerings and liquid offerings. These offerings are given as a special gift to the Lord, a pleasing aroma to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Ten days later, on the tenth day of the same month, you must call another holy assembly. On that day, the Day of Atonement, the people must go without food and must do no ordinary work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must present a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the Lord. It will consist of one young bull, one ram, and seven one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These offerings must be accompanied by the prescribed grain offerings of choice flour moistened with olive oil—six quarts of choice flour with the bull, four quarts of choice flour with the ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two quarts of choice flour with each of the seven lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice one male goat for a sin offering. This is in addition to the sin offering of atonement and the regular daily burnt offering with its grain offering, and their accompanying liquid offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Five days later, on the fifteenth day of the same month, you must call another holy assembly of all the people, and you may do no ordinary work on that day. It is the beginning of the Festival of Shelters, a seven-day festival to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the first day of the festival, you must present a burnt offering as a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord. It will consist of thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings must be accompanied by a grain offering of choice flour moistened with olive oil—six quarts for each of the thirteen bulls, four quarts for each of the two rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two quarts for each of the fourteen lambs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the second day of this seven-day festival, sacrifice twelve young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings of bulls, rams, and lambs must be accompanied by its prescribed grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the third day of the festival, sacrifice eleven young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings of bulls, rams, and lambs must be accompanied by its prescribed grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fourth day of the festival, sacrifice ten young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings of bulls, rams, and lambs must be accompanied by its prescribed grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the fifth day of the festival, sacrifice nine young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings of bulls, rams, and lambs must be accompanied by its prescribed grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the sixth day of the festival, sacrifice eight young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings of bulls, rams, and lambs must be accompanied by its prescribed grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice a male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the seventh day of the festival, sacrifice seven young bulls, two rams, and fourteen one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings of bulls, rams, and lambs must be accompanied by its prescribed grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On the eighth day of the festival, proclaim another holy day. You must do no ordinary work on that day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must present a burnt offering as a special gift, a pleasing aroma to the Lord. It will consist of one young bull, one ram, and seven one-year-old male lambs, all with no defects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of these offerings must be accompanied by its prescribed grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must also sacrifice one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its accompanying grain offering and liquid offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You must present these offerings to the Lord at your annual festivals. These are in addition to the sacrifices and offerings you present in connection with vows, or as voluntary offerings, burnt offerings, grain offerings, liquid offerings, or peace offerings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave all of these instructions to the people of Israel as the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses summoned the leaders of the tribes of Israel and told them, “This is what the Lord has commanded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man who makes a vow to the Lord or makes a pledge under oath must never break it. He must do exactly what he said he would do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a young woman makes a vow to the Lord or a pledge under oath while she is still living at her father’s home,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her father hears of the vow or pledge and does not object to it, then all her vows and pledges will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her father refuses to let her fulfill the vow or pledge on the day he hears of it, then all her vows and pledges will become invalid. The Lord will forgive her because her father would not let her fulfill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now suppose a young woman makes a vow or binds herself with an impulsive pledge and later marries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her husband learns of her vow or pledge and does not object on the day he hears of it, her vows and pledges will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband refuses to accept her vow or impulsive pledge on the day he hears of it, he nullifies her commitments, and the Lord will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, however, a woman is a widow or is divorced, she must fulfill all her vows and pledges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But suppose a woman is married and living in her husband’s home when she makes a vow or binds herself with a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her husband hears of it and does not object to it, her vow or pledge will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband refuses to accept it on the day he hears of it, her vow or pledge will be nullified, and the Lord will forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So her husband may either confirm or nullify any vows or pledges she makes to deny herself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he does not object on the day he hears of it, then he is agreeing to all her vows and pledges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he waits more than a day and then tries to nullify a vow or pledge, he will be punished for her guilt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the regulations the Lord gave Moses concerning relationships between a man and his wife, and between a father and a young daughter who still lives at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On behalf of the people of Israel, take revenge on the Midianites for leading them into idolatry. After that, you will die and join your ancestors.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to the people, “Choose some men, and arm them to fight the Lord’s war of revenge against Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From each tribe of Israel, send 1,000 men into battle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they chose 1,000 men from each tribe of Israel, a total of 12,000 men armed for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses sent them out, 1,000 men from each tribe, and Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest led them into battle. They carried along the holy objects of the sanctuary and the trumpets for sounding the charge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They attacked Midian as the Lord had commanded Moses, and they killed all the men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All five of the Midianite kings—Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba—died in the battle. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Israelite army captured the Midianite women and children and seized their cattle and flocks and all their wealth as plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They burned all the towns and villages where the Midianites had lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they had gathered the plunder and captives, both people and animals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they brought them all to Moses and Eleazar the priest, and to the whole community of Israel, which was camped on the plains of Moab beside the Jordan River, across from Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the community went to meet them outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses was furious with all the generals and captains who had returned from the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why have you let all the women live?” he demanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These are the very ones who followed Balaam’s advice and caused the people of Israel to rebel against the Lord at Mount Peor. They are the ones who caused the plague to strike the Lord’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So kill all the boys and all the women who have had intercourse with a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only the young girls who are virgins may live; you may keep them for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all of you who have killed anyone or touched a dead body must stay outside the camp for seven days. You must purify yourselves and your captives on the third and seventh days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Purify all your clothing, too, and everything made of leather, goat hair, or wood.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the men who were in the battle, “The Lord has given Moses this legal requirement:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anything made of gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, or lead—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that is, all metals that do not burn—must be passed through fire in order to be made ceremonially pure. These metal objects must then be further purified with the water of purification. But everything that burns must be purified by the water alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the seventh day you must wash your clothes and be purified. Then you may return to the camp.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You and Eleazar the priest and the family leaders of each tribe are to make a list of all the plunder taken in the battle, including the people and animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then divide the plunder into two parts, and give half to the men who fought the battle and half to the rest of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the army’s portion, first give the Lord his share of the plunder—one of every 500 of the prisoners and of the cattle, donkeys, sheep, and goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give this share of the army’s half to Eleazar the priest as an offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half that belongs to the people of Israel, take one of every fifty of the prisoners and of the cattle, donkeys, sheep, goats, and other animals. Give this share to the Levites, who are in charge of maintaining the Lord’s Tabernacle.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The plunder remaining from everything the fighting men had taken totaled 675,000 sheep and goats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 72,000 cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 61,000 donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 32,000 virgin girls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Half of the plunder was given to the fighting men. It totaled 337,500 sheep and goats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of which 675 were the Lord’s share;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 36,000 cattle, of which 72 were the Lord’s share;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 30,500 donkeys, of which 61 were the Lord’s share;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 16,000 virgin girls, of whom 32 were the Lord’s share.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave all the Lord’s share to Eleazar the priest, just as the Lord had directed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Half of the plunder belonged to the people of Israel, and Moses separated it from the half belonging to the fighting men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It totaled 337,500 sheep and goats,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 36,000 cattle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 30,500 donkeys,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and 16,000 virgin girls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half-share given to the people, Moses took one of every fifty prisoners and animals and gave them to the Levites, who maintained the Lord’s Tabernacle. All this was done as the Lord had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the generals and captains came to Moses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said, “We, your servants, have accounted for all the men who went out to battle under our command; not one of us is missing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we are presenting the items of gold we captured as an offering to the Lord from our share of the plunder—armbands, bracelets, rings, earrings, and necklaces. This will purify our lives before the Lord and make us right with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from all the military commanders—all kinds of jewelry and crafted objects.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all, the gold that the generals and captains presented as a gift to the Lord weighed about 420 pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the fighting men had taken some of the plunder for themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gifts from the generals and captains and brought the gold to the Tabernacle as a reminder to the Lord that the people of Israel belong to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes of Reuben and Gad owned vast numbers of livestock. So when they saw that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were ideally suited for their flocks and herds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they came to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the other leaders of the community. They said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Notice the towns of Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sibmah, Nebo, and Beon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord has conquered this whole area for the community of Israel, and it is ideally suited for all our livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we have found favor with you, please let us have this land as our property instead of giving us land across the Jordan River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do you intend to stay here while your brothers go across and do all the fighting?” Moses asked the men of Gad and Reuben.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why do you want to discourage the rest of the people of Israel from going across to the land the Lord has given them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ancestors did the same thing when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to explore the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After they went up to the valley of Eshcol and explored the land, they discouraged the people of Israel from entering the land the Lord was giving them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord was very angry with them, and he vowed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Of all those I rescued from Egypt, no one who is twenty years old or older will ever see the land I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, for they have not obeyed me wholeheartedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The only exceptions are Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, for they have wholeheartedly followed the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord was angry with Israel and made them wander in the wilderness for forty years until the entire generation that sinned in the Lord’s sight had died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But here you are, a brood of sinners, doing exactly the same thing! You are making the Lord even angrier with Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you turn away from him like this and he abandons them again in the wilderness, you will be responsible for destroying this entire nation!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they approached Moses and said, “We simply want to build pens for our livestock and fortified towns for our wives and children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we will arm ourselves and lead our fellow Israelites into battle until we have brought them safely to their land. Meanwhile, our families will stay in the fortified towns we build here, so they will be safe from any attacks by the local people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will not return to our homes until all the people of Israel have received their portions of land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we do not claim any of the land on the other side of the Jordan. We would rather live here on the east side and accept this as our grant of land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said, “If you keep your word and arm yourselves for the Lord’s battles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if your troops cross the Jordan and keep fighting until the Lord has driven out his enemies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you may return when the Lord has conquered the land. You will have fulfilled your duty to the Lord and to the rest of the people of Israel. And the land on the east side of the Jordan will be your property from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you fail to keep your word, then you will have sinned against the Lord, and you may be sure that your sin will find you out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go ahead and build towns for your families and pens for your flocks, but do everything you have promised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men of Gad and Reuben replied, “We, your servants, will follow your instructions exactly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our children, wives, flocks, and cattle will stay here in the towns of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all who are able to bear arms will cross over to fight for the Lord, just as you have said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave orders to Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders of the clans of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said, “The men of Gad and Reuben who are armed for battle must cross the Jordan with you to fight for the Lord. If they do, give them the land of Gilead as their property when the land is conquered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they refuse to arm themselves and cross over with you, then they must accept land with the rest of you in the land of Canaan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tribes of Gad and Reuben said again, “We are your servants, and we will do as the Lord has commanded!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will cross the Jordan into Canaan fully armed to fight for the Lord, but our property will be here on this side of the Jordan.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses assigned land to the tribes of Gad, Reuben, and half the tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph. He gave them the territory of King Sihon of the Amorites and the land of King Og of Bashan—the whole land with its cities and surrounding lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Gad built the towns of Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran. These were all fortified towns with pens for their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The descendants of Reuben built the towns of Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nebo, Baal-meon, and Sibmah. They changed the names of some of the towns they conquered and rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the descendants of Makir of the tribe of Manasseh went to Gilead and conquered it, and they drove out the Amorites living there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave Gilead to the Makirites, descendants of Manasseh, and they settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of Jair, another clan of the tribe of Manasseh, captured many of the towns in Gilead and changed the name of that region to the Towns of Jair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, a man named Nobah captured the town of Kenath and its surrounding villages, and he renamed that area Nobah after himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the route the Israelites followed as they marched out of Egypt under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the Lord’s direction, Moses kept a written record of their progress. These are the stages of their march, identified by the different places where they stopped along the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set out from the city of Rameses in early spring—on the fifteenth day of the first month—on the morning after the first Passover celebration. The people of Israel left defiantly, in full view of all the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn sons, whom the Lord had killed the night before. The Lord had defeated the gods of Egypt that night with great acts of judgment!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After leaving Rameses, the Israelites set up camp at Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they left Succoth and camped at Etham on the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Etham and turned back toward Pi-hahiroth, opposite Baal-zephon, and camped near Migdol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Pi-hahiroth and crossed the Red Sea into the wilderness beyond. Then they traveled for three days into the Etham wilderness and camped at Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Marah and camped at Elim, where there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Elim and camped beside the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the Red Sea and camped in the wilderness of Sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the wilderness of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Dophkah and camped at Alush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Rephidim and camped in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth-hattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Kibroth-hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Rithmah and camped at Rimmon-perez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Rimmon-perez and camped at Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Libnah and camped at Rissah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Tahath and camped at Terah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Terah and camped at Mithcah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Mithcah and camped at Hashmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Moseroth and camped at Bene-jaakan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Bene-jaakan and camped at Hor-haggidgad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Hor-haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Abronah and camped at Ezion-geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Ezion-geber and camped at Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, at the border of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were at the foot of Mount Hor, Aaron the priest was directed by the Lord to go up the mountain, and there he died. This happened in midsummer, on the first day of the fifth month of the fortieth year after Israel’s departure from Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron was 123 years old when he died there on Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard that the people of Israel were approaching his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the Israelites left Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they left Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Punon and camped at Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim on the border of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Iye-abarim and camped at Dibon-gad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Dibon-gad and camped at Almon-diblathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left Almon-diblathaim and camped in the mountains east of the river, near Mount Nebo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left the mountains east of the river and camped on the plains of Moab beside the Jordan River, across from Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along the Jordan River they camped from Beth-jeshimoth as far as the meadows of Acacia on the plains of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they were camped near the Jordan River on the plains of Moab opposite Jericho, the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give the following instructions to the people of Israel: When you cross the Jordan River into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you must drive out all the people living there. You must destroy all their carved and molten images and demolish all their pagan shrines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take possession of the land and settle in it, because I have given it to you to occupy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must distribute the land among the clans by sacred lot and in proportion to their size. A larger portion of land will be allotted to each of the larger clans, and a smaller portion will be allotted to each of the smaller clans. The decision of the sacred lot is final. In this way, the portions of land will be divided among your ancestral tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you fail to drive out the people who live in the land, those who remain will be like splinters in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will harass you in the land where you live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will do to you what I had planned to do to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Give these instructions to the Israelites: When you come into the land of Canaan, which I am giving you as your special possession, these will be the boundaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The southern portion of your country will extend from the wilderness of Zin, along the edge of Edom. The southern boundary will begin on the east at the Dead Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will then run south past Scorpion Pass in the direction of Zin. Its southernmost point will be Kadesh-barnea, from which it will go to Hazar-addar, and on to Azmon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Azmon the boundary will turn toward the Brook of Egypt and end at the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your western boundary will be the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your northern boundary will begin at the Mediterranean Sea and run east to Mount Hor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then to Lebo-hamath, and on through Zedad
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ziphron to Hazar-enan. This will be your northern boundary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The eastern boundary will start at Hazar-enan and run south to Shepham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then down to Riblah on the east side of Ain. From there the boundary will run down along the eastern edge of the Sea of Galilee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then along the Jordan River to the Dead Sea. These are the boundaries of your land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses told the Israelites, “This territory is the homeland you are to divide among yourselves by sacred lot. The Lord has commanded that the land be divided among the nine and a half remaining tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh have already received their grants of land
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the east side of the Jordan River, across from Jericho toward the sunrise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun are the men designated to divide the grants of land among the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enlist one leader from each tribe to help them with the task.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the tribes and the names of the leaders:TribeLeaderJudah Caleb son of Jephunneh
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simeon Shemuel son of Ammihud
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benjamin Elidad son of Kislon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan Bukki son of Jogli
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh son of Joseph Hanniel son of Ephod
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim son of Joseph Kemuel son of Shiphtan
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebulun Elizaphan son of Parnach
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Issachar Paltiel son of Azzan
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asher Ahihud son of Shelomi
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naphtali Pedahel son of Ammihud
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the men the Lord has appointed to divide the grants of land in Canaan among the Israelites.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Israel was camped beside the Jordan on the plains of Moab across from Jericho, the Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Command the people of Israel to give to the Levites from their property certain towns to live in, along with the surrounding pasturelands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These towns will be for the Levites to live in, and the surrounding lands will provide pasture for their cattle, flocks, and other livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The pastureland assigned to the Levites around these towns will extend 1,500 feet from the town walls in every direction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Measure off 3,000 feet outside the town walls in every direction—east, south, west, north—with the town at the center. This area will serve as the larger pastureland for the towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Six of the towns you give the Levites will be cities of refuge, where a person who has accidentally killed someone can flee for safety. In addition, give them forty-two other towns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all, forty-eight towns with the surrounding pastureland will be given to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These towns will come from the property of the people of Israel. The larger tribes will give more towns to the Levites, while the smaller tribes will give fewer. Each tribe will give property in proportion to the size of its land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Give the following instructions to the people of Israel.
“When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: designate cities of refuge to which people can flee if they have killed someone accidentally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities will be places of protection from a dead person’s relatives who want to avenge the death. The slayer must not be put to death before being tried by the community.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Designate six cities of refuge for yourselves,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three on the east side of the Jordan River and three on the west in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These cities are for the protection of Israelites, foreigners living among you, and traveling merchants. Anyone who accidentally kills someone may flee there for safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if someone strikes and kills another person with a piece of iron, it is murder, and the murderer must be executed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if someone with a stone in his hand strikes and kills another person, it is murder, and the murderer must be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if someone strikes and kills another person with a wooden object, it is murder, and the murderer must be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The victim’s nearest relative is responsible for putting the murderer to death. When they meet, the avenger must put the murderer to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if someone hates another person and waits in ambush, then pushes him or throws something at him and he dies, it is murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if someone hates another person and hits him with a fist and he dies, it is murder. In such cases, the avenger must put the murderer to death when they meet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But suppose someone pushes another person without having shown previous hostility, or throws something that unintentionally hits another person,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or accidentally drops a huge stone on someone, though they were not enemies, and the person dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this should happen, the community must follow these regulations in making a judgment between the slayer and the avenger, the victim’s nearest relative:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The community must protect the slayer from the avenger and must escort the slayer back to live in the city of refuge to which he fled. There he must remain until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the sacred oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the slayer ever leaves the limits of the city of refuge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the avenger finds him outside the city and kills him, it will not be considered murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slayer should have stayed inside the city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest, the slayer may return to his own property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are legal requirements for you to observe from generation to generation, wherever you may live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All murderers must be put to death, but only if evidence is presented by more than one witness. No one may be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, you must never accept a ransom payment for the life of someone judged guilty of murder and subject to execution; murderers must always be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And never accept a ransom payment from someone who has fled to a city of refuge, allowing a slayer to return to his property before the death of the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will ensure that the land where you live will not be polluted, for murder pollutes the land. And no sacrifice except the execution of the murderer can purify the land from murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You must not defile the land where you live, for I live there myself. I am the Lord, who lives among the people of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the heads of the clans of Gilead—descendants of Makir, son of Manasseh, son of Joseph—came to Moses and the family leaders of Israel with a petition.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Sir, the Lord instructed you to divide the land by sacred lot among the people of Israel. You were told by the Lord to give the grant of land owned by our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they marry men from another tribe, their grants of land will go with them to the tribe into which they marry. In this way, the total area of our tribal land will be reduced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when the Year of Jubilee comes, their portion of land will be added to that of the new tribe, causing it to be lost forever to our ancestral tribe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses gave the Israelites this command from the Lord: “The claim of the men of the tribe of Joseph is legitimate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: Let them marry anyone they like, as long as it is within their own ancestral tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the territorial land may pass from tribe to tribe, for all the land given to each tribe must remain within the tribe to which it was first allotted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughters throughout the tribes of Israel who are in line to inherit property must marry within their tribe, so that all the Israelites will keep their ancestral property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No grant of land may pass from one tribe to another; each tribe of Israel must keep its allotted portion of land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughters of Zelophehad did as the Lord commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah all married cousins on their father’s side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They married into the clans of Manasseh son of Joseph. Thus, their inheritance of land remained within their ancestral tribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commands and regulations that the Lord gave to the people of Israel through Moses while they were camped on the plains of Moab beside the Jordan River, across from Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
